alert.note: Alert for Chaffee; Fremont; Teller (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 08 at 9:15AM MST until December 08 at 9:45AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Chaffee County in central Colorado... Fremont County in central Colorado... Southwestern Teller County in central Colorado... * Until 945 AM MST. * At 915 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 7 miles south of Guffey to 8 miles west of Royal Gorge to near Texas Creek, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Highway 50 between Salida and Canon City. Locations impacted include... Cripple Creek, Victor, Texas Creek, Royal Gorge, Coaldale, Waugh Mountain, Cotopaxi, and Canon City. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
